Co-developers:  
Scott McKenney (Y-12)  
Robert Hunter (Oak Ridge National Laboratory) 
John Hopkins (University of Tennessee Research Corporation)  
Michael Hamilton (MCH Corporation, Sweetwater, TN),  
Himadri Banerjee (RAMSAFE Technologies, LLC, Oak Ridge, TN) 
 
The RAMSAFE technology was initiated from a request by the US Army to utilize Y-12’s unique capabilities to develop a disaster software package. Y-12 collaborated with ORNL, UT Research Corp. and MCH to develop the software necessary to meet the Army’s needs. This team, under Y-12 management, integrated a diverse set of databases and imagery to achieve an interactive solution for disaster management. 
 
RAMSAFE software stores and organizes massive amounts of critical data about a location or special event before an incident happens. During crises, RAMSAFE users are armed with total on-scene situational awareness. The software provides detailed forecasts of casualties, necessary command-level responses, specific time-phased resource requirements and online access to personnel and resource shortfall information. RAMSAFE’s predictive models also change as a situation unfolds. RAMSAFE could reduce human and economic loss by as much as 50% in a biohazard event. 
 
RAMSAFE software was developed at the DOE/NNSA Y-12 facility in a collaborative effort with Oak Ridge National Laboratory, University of Tennessee Research Corporation, and MCH Corp. RAMSAFE was initially deployed at the 2002 International Olympic Games in Salt Lake City, Utah.  
 
This technology was initially developed as a Work For Others project funded by the US Army. It was copyrighted by Y-12 who then issued an exclusive license to the two laboratory developers who formed Public Safety Systems, Inc. The technology was subsequently sublicensed and enhanced by RAMSAFE Technologies, LLC. Developer (Contractor) - Content Management Cisco Systems Ltd November 2002  –  January 2005  (2 years 3 months) This was a project to revamp the WPR Cisco intranet site, with a view to adopting a Content Managements System that could be used by non technical users and improving the content displayed by that web site. 
 
The first stage was to evaluate and report on the current Content Management Systems used within Cisco. During this time I was the key technical advisor. 
 
Based on my analysis and its subsequent recommendations the next stage was to manage the deployment of the selected CMS. At the same time I was responsible for maintaining the content of the existing system. 
 
We have recently deployed the new Global Web site.  
 
Interesting aspects of this project involved imbedding java based scripts to pull information from key databases to display within the site such as writing an Oracle based search engine to integrate with the CMS. Java Developer (Contractor) - Portlets Cisco Systems Ltd November 2002  –  January 2005  (2 years 3 months) This project involved reviewing the Portal strategy for Cisco WPR. At the moment I am implementing the Portal Strategy Framework to build a java based portal for the WPR division using Jetspeed (and its associated technologies Torque, Turbine and Velocity). One of the core ideas behind the portal is to utilize the information held in the WPR Oracle Data Warehouse. 
 
One of the portlets that I have developed for this project is an Expense Variance Analysis Portlet. The portlet queries expense data from the Oracle Data Warehouse, allowing department managers to reconcile their commit and actual expense data. Others include a News portlet and Cases portlet. The cases portlet allows users to see the progress of support cases they raised and also those that have been assigned to them. Java Developer (Contractor) - Sales Generation Application Cisco Systems Ltd November 2002  –  January 2005  (2 years 3 months) I was responsible for designing and building a Web Application for WPR Sales Generation. The function of the application was to record and report the effectiveness of Cisco Work Place Resources department in aiding the Sales process. I was involved in the entire life cycle of this project from analysis and design through to development, testing and deployment. The tool was developed using Java J2EE and Oracle and hosted on a Borland Enterprise Web Server. Java Developer (Contractor) - Interview Application Cisco Systems Ltd November 2002  –  January 2005  (2 years 3 months) The Interview Application I developed enabled Cisco to record interviews within a Web Application and create reports and chart outputs using the information captured. The system was created in a way that allowed interview questions to be defined dynamically. These questions could range from free text to multiple choice etc. The interviewers could then use the system to carry out their interviews. The reports that could then be generated could be sliced and diced based on region (EMEA, JAPAN, US, ASIAPAC, US International), country, manager etc, with the results displayed on charts. 
 
The actual application was developed using Java J2ee with Oracle as the database. Summary With locations in Arizona and California, LifeLock is a growing, performance-driven company that helps our employees follow their career passions. Our teams work at the forefront of the identity-theft protection industry, using and developing next-generation technology to help protect consumers against identity fraud before damage can be done to their identity. 
 
Founded in 2005, LifeLock builds products that give our customers the confidence to live freely in an always-connected world. Our core identity theft protection service helps our nearly 4 million members monitor their identity for breaches online and offline.  
 
We look for people that want to help build products that sit at the intersection of security, privacy, and convenience. We take pride in our culture of problem solving and collaboration and we’d love to talk to you about joining us! 
 
We're hiring! Apply - www.lifelock.jobs

Summary - - - - - TRAINING MANAGER - INSRUCTIONAL DESIGNER - TRAINER - - - -  
• I am a seasoned Training Manager, Instructional Designer and Trainer. For 18 years I have successfully defined, designed and implemented training initiatives for Cisco, Hewlett-Packard, Applied Materials, Xilinx, H&R Block, Marketo and InterWise.  
• I save organizations valuable time and resources by thoroughly identifying needs, gaining consensus and building concise projects plans. 
• I believe in accountability and commit myself 100% to the successful implementation of each project on which I work. 
• I communicate clearly and effectively.  
• I design training for audiences of 8-8000 adult learners. 
• I am well-versed on a wide range of subject matter – ERP, marketing, sales, real estate, US and California income tax law, and finance.  
• I am a creative and succinct instructional designer, an approachable, collaborative leader and an engaging trainer. 
• I excel at the delivery of traditional classroom and live, online training (via InterWise, HP Classroom, Centra and Web-Ex).  
• I wrote scripts and provided voiceover talent for Applied Materials, Tyson Foods and InterWise. 
• I collaboratively engage and build strong relationships with stakeholders and subject matter experts. Summary - - - - - TRAINING MANAGER - INSRUCTIONAL DESIGNER - TRAINER - - - -
